org.jdesktop.jdic.fileutil
Interface FileIterator

public interface FileIterator

An iterator over a directory. The FileIterator class offer methods to traverse a diretory incrementally.

See Also:
File

Method Summary
 void close()
          Closes the FileIterator object, releasing resources immediately.
 boolean hasNext()
          Returns true if the next method would return a File object in the directory.
 File next()
          Returns the next File object in the directory.
 

Method Detail

hasNext

boolean hasNext()
                throws IOException
Returns true if the next method would return a File object in the directory.

Returns:
true if the iterator has more elements.
Throws:
IOException

next

File next()
          throws NoSuchElementException
Returns the next File object in the directory.

Returns:
the next File in the directory.
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if there are no more File objects in the directory.

close

void close()
Closes the FileIterator object, releasing resources immediately. The FileIterator is automatically closed when the hasNext method returns false or when the object is garbage collected.
